intro: Psychotria longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stalked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, often attracting various bird species. Psychotria longipedicellata is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses in traditional medicine.
